From 1554 he was King of Naples and Sicily as well as Duke of Milan. During his marriage to Queen Mary I, he was also King of England and Ireland;https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philip_II_of_Spain;-

tt:span.ttm:wiki: definition;superstition;fact;-;Superstition is the belief in supernatural causality — that one event causes another without any natural process linking the two events — such as astrology and certain aspects linked to religion, like omens, witchcraft and prophecies, that contradict natural science;https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superstition;-

tt:span.ttm:wiki: definition;tapeworm;fact;https://www.google.co.uk/search?q=tapeworm&espv=2&biw=1920&bih=979&source=lnms&tbm=isch&sa=X&sqi=2&ved=0ahUKEwjPq4jEgazJAhXCXRoKHQKyBbQQ_AUIBigB&dpr=1;Tapeworm infection is the infestation of the digestive tract by a species of parasitic cestodal flatworm called tapeworms. Live tapeworm larvae (coenuri) are sometimes ingested by consuming undercooked food. Once inside the digestive tract, a larva can grow into a very large adult tapeworm;https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tapeworm_infection;-

tt:p.tt:span: But I suggest you either put it out
of its misery or call the RSPCA.
Is this some kind of joke?

tt:p.ttm:wiki: Cavaliers;Cavalier army;fact;-;Cavalier was a name first used by Parliamentarians as a term of abuse for the wealthier male Royalist supporters of King Charles I and his son Charles II during the English Civil War, the Interregnum, and the Restoration (1642 – c. 1679);https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cavalier;http://www.bbc.co.uk/bitesize/ks3/history/tudors_stuarts/charles_i_civil_war/revision/5/;-

historical figure;King Charles I of England;fact;https://www.google.co.uk/search?q=King+Charles+I&biw=1920&bih=979&noj=1&source=lnms&tbm=isch&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwi9spW9h6zJAhXC1hQKHbu7CakQ_AUICCgB#imgrc=hHUCDVRGIQzyMM%3A;Charles I (1600 - 1649) was king of England, Scotland and Ireland, whose conflicts with parliament led to civil war and his eventual execution;http://www.bbc.co.uk/history/historic_figures/charles_i_king.shtml;-
tt:p.tt:span: Nephew of King Charles I, no less.

tt:p.ttm:wiki: animal;poodle;fact;https://www.google.co.uk/search?q=poodle&noj=1&source=lnms&tbm=isch&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwia3562iKzJAhWGkw8KHTqlACcQ_AUICCgB&biw=1920&bih=979#imgrc=ZCasHGhWwXFgHM%3A;There are three sizes of Poodle - Toy, Miniature and Standard – all in a wide range of beautiful solid colours. The Poodle’s coat does not shed, but regular grooming is essential. For the fashion-conscious, there are many different styles in which he can be clipped;http://www.thekennelclub.org.uk/services/public/breed/display.aspx?id=4097#sthash.VjlcnjHG.dpuf;http://www.thekennelclub.org.uk/services/public/breed/display.aspx?id=4097;-
tt:p.tt:span: I would like to buy a poodle.
A white one that does a dance
of my uncle, King Charles I.
He's my uncle, did I mention?
so that shouldn't be a problem.
And I'd like him to cock his leg

tt:p.ttm:wiki: historical figure;John Pym;fact;https://www.google.co.uk/search?q=John+Pym&noj=1&source=lnms&tbm=isch&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwicn5aNiazJAhVE1hQKHXnUBNoQ_AUICCgB&biw=1920&bih=979;John Pym (1584 – 8 December 1643) was an English parliamentarian, leader of the Long Parliament and a prominent critic of Kings James I and then Charles I. He was one of the five Members whose attempted arrest by King Charles I in the House of Commons of England in 1642 sparked the Civil War;https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Pym;-
tt:p.tt:span: every time he hears the name Pym.

tt:p.ttm:wiki: definition;Roundhead;fact;-;Roundhead was the name given to the supporters of the Parliament of England during the English Civil War. Also known as Parliamentarians, they fought against Charles I of England and his supporters, the Cavaliers or Royalists, who claimed rule by absolute monarchy and the divine right of kings;https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roundhead;-

tt:p.tt:span: I used to take him into battle
with me and he sort of got shot.
Battles are no places for dogs!
before I set mine on you.

tt:span.ttm:wiki: historical act;persecution of protestants;fact;-;The first queen to rule England in her own right, she was known as Bloody Mary for her persecution of Protestants in a vain attempt to restore Catholicism in England;http://www.bbc.co.uk/history/historic_figures/mary_i_queen.shtml;-

tt:p.tt:span: when you say the word Pym.
Oh, will you look at that!
Whenever someone said the word Pym,
Prince Rupert's poodle did a pee.
Or did his peedle do a poo?
So we're done with the silly sketch
about a dead dog. What's up next?
A sketch featuring a dead horse?
who has planned the entire wedding
But will it be a day to remember

tt:p.ttm:wiki: TV Programme;Don't Tell The Bride;fact;https://www.google.co.uk/search?q=Don%27t+tell+the+bride&noj=1&source=lnms&tbm=isch&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiR-NLCiqzJAhWCzxQKHWZrBj8Q_AUICigD&biw=1920&bih=979#imgrc=quZQfdhWsqqRZM%3A;Series in which the groom must choose every detail of his wedding, from venue to cake to wedding dress;www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b00d7mtr;-

tt:p.tt:span: so they've refused to give her away.
So do you. Is everything ready?
Into the church to get married.
Dagle found that a church wedding
are to be married...by a tramp.
Darling, this is our new priest.
are we getting married by a tramp?
Oh, he's a priest as well, sort of!
He's just a travelling tramp one.
Good value? Is it even legal?
That is a very good question,
and in answer to that I'd like
to say your hair looks lovely.
such a ceremony in some way
Though some elements of the stroller
Why is there a dead horse
Can we just get on with it please,
By the power invested in me,
I now pronounce you man and wife.
You can have a kiss or whatever.
Believe me, every time you look at
my face, you'll remember this day.
When you put it that way!
'Scuse me, do you by any chance
gave you all the fearsome facts...

tt:p.tt:span: Just go to the CBBC website
